alert.note: Alert for Caledonia; Lamoille; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 5:42PM EDT until July 09 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON, WESTERN CALEDONIA AND SOUTHEASTERN LAMOILLE COUNTIES... At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Woodbury, Elmore, Wolcott, Hardwick, Calais, Worcester, South Woodbury, North Calais, East Calais, Maple Corner, Kents Corners and Hardwick Center. At 524 PM, the local fire department reported flash flooding at the intersection of route 14 and Blake Hill Road in Woodbury. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
